page.title: 14Leisure in Snape, Yorkshire.
page.content: Snape is a small village, but there is plenty to do in it. The hall is used for many things. There are domino drives, dances, discos, concerts, parties and plays which are held fairly regularly. People go to meetings and clubs in the hall and you can play badminton there. During the Summer holidays children can attend the Holiday Club in the hall. There is a Youth Club which meets in the Chapel and children can go to Sunshine Corner. The village has a park to play in and a playing field which is used for playing football, rounders, rugby and cricket. There is one pub in Snape with a small site for touring caravans.
